meanings.definition: Relating to or indicating a process that takes place at constant temperature.
meanings.sent1: The experiment required an isothermal environment to ensure the temperature stayed the same throughout.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the isothermal conditions to understand how temperature affects the reaction.
meanings.sent3: The isothermal room was so steady in temperature that even the ice cream didn't melt!
meanings.sent4: Her calm demeanor was like an isothermal presence in the midst of chaos.
meanings.sent5: The isothermal heat of the desert sun beat down relentlessly on the travelers.

meanings.definition: A line on a map connecting points having the same temperature at a given time.
meanings.sent1: The meteorologist drew an isothermal line on the map to show areas with similar temperatures.
meanings.sent2: The hiker followed the isothermal line to avoid sudden temperature changes.
meanings.sent3: The isothermal line on the map looked like a colorful snake winding through the landscape.
meanings.sent4: The isothermal boundary separated the warm region from the cooler one like a clear division.
meanings.sent5: The isothermal marking on the map made it easy to identify temperature patterns across the area.
